Different Crime.Crime Name: Immigration-related risk assessment and humanitarian claims
reasonableness_standard: PRRA and H&C decisions are reviewed under the reasonableness standard, considering justification, transparency, and intelligibility.
evidence_assessment: The Officer dismissed letters from family and professionals as 'not disinterested' without context, ignored contradictions, and failed to properly weigh evidence.
decision_outcome: Court granted judicial review, invalidating both PRRA and H&C decisions for re-assessment by another Officer.
risk_of_persecution: Applicants claimed risk of persecution in Mexico
standard_of_proof: Judicial review applications filed after rejection of PRRA and H&C claims; analyzed under reasonableness standard.
burden_of_proof: Both PRRA and H&C decisions are unreasonable due to flawed evidence assessment; judicial review granted.
